        My understanding from looking at <span class="line"><!---->My understanding from looking at <!----></span>https://crbug.com/1146679<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1146679" title="Security: WeakPtr checks are optimized out"><!---->https://crbug.com/1146679<!----></a>, as mentioned in <span class="line"><!---->, as mentioned in <!----></span>Comment #2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c2"><!---->Comment #2<!----></a>, is that this UaF might already be fixed by <span class="line"><!---->, is that this UaF might already be fixed by <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/2463857<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2463857"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2463857<!----></a> (and M86/87 cherry-picks), which introduced CHECKs for operator* and operator->. (Or maybe not, since I'm unsure if AsWeakPtr() will hit the introduced CHECKs, or if it just hits the WeakPtr::get().)<span class="line"><!----> (and M86/87 cherry-picks), which introduced CHECKs for operator* and operator-&gt;. (Or maybe not, since I'm unsure if AsWeakPtr() will hit the introduced CHECKs, or if it just hits the WeakPtr::get().)<!----></span><br><br>I added an early return in this CL[1] to fix this issue, and avoid the UaF or CHECK crash. That said, I'm not a pepper / Filesystem OWNER[2], so I think //ppapi/OWNERS might be the right people to own this bug if this issue becomes more complex.<span class="line"><!---->I added an early return in this CL[1] to fix this issue, and avoid the UaF or CHECK crash.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {

          }
        }
      </style>

        }

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by wfh@chromium.org (Nov 6, 2020)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by wfh@chromium.org (Nov 6, 2020)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by wfh@chromium.org (Nov 6, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by wfh@chromium.org (Nov 6, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      See parent bug for full exploit. This is for the sandbox escape part.<span class="line"><!---->See parent bug for full exploit. This is for the sandbox escape part.<!----></span><br><br># Sandbox Escape<span class="line"><!----># Sandbox Escape<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<span class="line"><!---->|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<span class="line"><!---->int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<span class="line"><!---->  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host->GetFileSystemHost(); <-----<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host-&gt;GetFileSystemHost(); &lt;-----<!----></span><br>  open_flags_ = open_flags;<span class="line"><!---->  open_flags_ = open_flags;<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<span class="line"><!---->And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<span class="line"><!---->void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  found->second->SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<span class="line"><!---->  found-&gt;second-&gt;SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<!----></span><br>  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found->second); <--------<span class="line"><!---->  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found-&gt;second); &lt;--------<!----></span><br>  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<span class="line"><!---->  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<span class="line"><!---->This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_->GetFileSystemOperationRunner()->OpenFile(<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_-&gt;GetFileSystemOperationRunner()-&gt;OpenFile(<!----></span><br>      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<span class="line"><!---->      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <span class="line"><!---->I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>    if (check_quota_)<span class="line"><!---->    if (check_quota_)<!----></span><br>      quota_file_system = file_system_host_->pp_resource();<span class="line"><!---->      quota_file_system = file_system_host_-&gt;pp_resource();<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<span class="line"><!---->After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<a         Hey huangdarwin@, it's late on a Friday night, so it's that time again! Urgent security bug time!<span class="line"><!---->Hey huangdarwin@, it's late on a Friday night, so it's that time again! Urgent security bug time!<!----></span><br><br>In all seriousness I am regarding this as Pri-1 which means it can wait till Monday. Nevertheless I do think you're probably the best owner so please do look on Monday.<span class="line"><!---->In all seriousness I am regarding this as Pri-1 which means it can wait till Monday. Nevertheless I do think you're probably the best owner so please do look on Monday.<!----></span><br><br>What we have here is a situation where code is relying on a WeakPtr, and the compiler is optimising out the WeakPtr check. I feel we should fix WeakPtr, for which I've raised <span class="line"><!---->What we have here is a situation where code is relying on a WeakPtr, and the compiler is optimising out the WeakPtr check. I feel we should fix WeakPtr, for which I've raised <!----></span>issue 1146679<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1146679" title="Security: WeakPtr checks are optimized out"><!---->issue 1146679<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>but please can you own whether any changes are needed in the filesystem code.<span class="line"><!---->but please can you own whether any changes are needed in the filesystem code.<!----></span><br><br>You're unlikely to be able to reproduce this. The bug is part of an exploit chain submitted at the Tian Fu Cup today, and it's a pretty complex POC. However, if you really need to reproduce this, I think we might be able to pick it apart and get the MojoJS bits running without the rest of the exploit - using these instructions - <span class="line"><!---->You're unlikely to be able to reproduce this. The bug is part of an exploit chain submitted at the Tian Fu Cup today, and it's a pretty complex POC. However, if you really need to reproduce this, I think we might be able to pick it apart and get the MojoJS bits running without the rest of the exploit - using these instructions - <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/clusterfuzz-for-sheriffs.md#mojojs<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/clusterfuzz-for-sheriffs.md#mojojs"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/clusterfuzz-for-sheriffs.md#mojojs<!----></a> - but it will take many hours so I'm hoping you don't need that.<span class="line"><!----> - but it will take many hours so I'm hoping you don't need that.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        My understanding from looking at <span class="line"><!---->My understanding from looking at <!----></span>https://crbug.com/1146679<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1146679" title="Security: WeakPtr checks are optimized out"><!---->https://crbug.com/1146679<!----></a>, as mentioned in <span class="line"><!---->, as mentioned in <!----></span>Comment #2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c2"><!---->Comment #2<!----></a>, is that this UaF might already be fixed by <span class="line"><!---->, is that this UaF might already be fixed by <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/2463857<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2463857"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2463857<!----></a> (and M86/87 cherry-picks), which introduced CHECKs for operator* and operator->. (Or maybe not, since I'm unsure if AsWeakPtr() will hit the introduced CHECKs, or if it just hits the WeakPtr::get().)<span class="line"><!----> (and M86/87 cherry-picks), which introduced CHECKs for operator* and operator-&gt;. (Or maybe not, since I'm unsure if AsWeakPtr() will hit the introduced CHECKs, or if it just hits the WeakPtr::get().)<!----></span><br><br>I added an early return in this CL[1] to fix this issue, and avoid the UaF or CHECK crash. That said, I'm not a pepper / Filesystem OWNER[2], so I think //ppapi/OWNERS might be the right people to own this bug if this issue becomes more complex.<span class="line"><!---->I added an early return in this CL[1] to fix this issue, and avoid the UaF or CHECK crash. That said, I'm not a pepper / Filesystem OWNER[2], so I think //ppapi/OWNERS might be the right people to own this bug if this issue becomes more complex.<!----></span><br><br>+cc: ppapi owners, for visibility during review.<span class="line"><!---->+cc: ppapi owners, for visibility during review.<!----></span><br><br>[1]: <span class="line"><!---->[1]: <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/2527065<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2527065"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2527065<!----></a><br>[2]: <span class="line"><!---->[2]: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/OWNERS<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/OWNERS"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/OWNERS<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug requires manual review: We are only 6 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 6 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <!----></span>http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br><br>Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Owners: benmason@(Android), bindusuvarna @(iOS), cindyb@(ChromeOS), lakpamarthy@(Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: benmason@(Android), bindusuvarna @(iOS), cindyb@(ChromeOS), lakpamarthy@(Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by wfh@chromium.org (Nov 6, 2020)

      </div>
      See parent bug for full exploit. This is for the sandbox escape part.<span class="line"><!---->See parent bug for full exploit. This is for the sandbox escape part.<!----></span><br><br># Sandbox Escape<span class="line"><!----># Sandbox Escape<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<span class="line"><!---->|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<span class="line"><!---->int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<span class="line"><!---->  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host->GetFileSystemHost(); <-----<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host-&gt;GetFileSystemHost(); &lt;-----<!----></span><br>  open_flags_ = open_flags;<span class="line"><!---->  open_flags_ = open_flags;<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<span class="line"><!---->And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<span class="line"><!---->void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  found->second->SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<span class="line"><!---->  found-&gt;second-&gt;SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<!----></span><br>  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found->second); <--------<span class="line"><!---->  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found-&gt;second); &lt;--------<!----></span><br>  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<span class="line"><!---->  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<span class="line"><!---->This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_->GetFileSystemOperationRunner()->OpenFile(<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_-&gt;GetFileSystemOperationRunner()-&gt;OpenFile(<!----></span><br>      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<span class="line"><!---->      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <span class="line"><!---->I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>    if (check_quota_)<span class="line"><!---->    if (check_quota_)<!----></span><br>      quota_file_system = file_system_host_->pp_resource();<span class="line"><!---->      quota_file_system = file_system_host_-&gt;pp_resource();<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<span class="line"><!---->After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<!----></a><br><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ppapi/host/ppapi_host.cc;l=262;drc=708fa822987d1b2146ce2659156a7713ac5e6810<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         I raised <span class="line"><!---->I raised <!----></span>issue 1146679<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1146679" title="Security: WeakPtr checks are optimized out"><!---->issue 1146679<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>for the more general problem of WeakPtr checks being optimized out.<span class="line"><!---->for the more general problem of WeakPtr checks being optimized out.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 3<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146675#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by

Nevertheless I do think you're probably the best owner so please do look on Monday.<!----></span><br><br>What we have here is a situation where code is relying on a WeakPtr, and the compiler is optimising out the WeakPtr check. I feel we should fix WeakPtr, for which I've raised <span class="line"><!---->What we have here is a situation where code is relying on a WeakPtr, and the compiler is optimising out the WeakPtr check. I feel we should fix WeakPtr, for which I've raised <!----></span>issue 1146679<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1146679" title="Security: WeakPtr checks are optimized out"><!---->issue 1146679<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>but please can you own whether any changes are needed in the filesystem code.<span class="line"><!---->but please can you own whether any changes are needed in the filesystem code.<!----></span><br><br>You're unlikely to be able to reproduce this. The bug is part of an exploit chain submitted at the Tian Fu Cup today, and it's a pretty complex POC.         by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146675#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Nov 9, 2020, 6:29 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>

      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        My understanding from looking at <span class="line"><!---->My understanding from looking at <!----></span>https://crbug.com/1146679<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1146679" title="Security: WeakPtr checks are optimized out"><!---->https://crbug.com/1146679<!----></a>, as mentioned in <span class="line"><!---->, as mentioned in <!----></span>Comment #2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c2"><!---->Comment #2<!----></a>, is that this UaF might already be fixed by <span class="line"><!---->, is that this UaF might already be fixed by <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/2463857<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2463857"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2463857<!----></a> (and M86/87 cherry-picks), which introduced CHECKs for operator* and operator->. (Or maybe not, since I'm unsure if AsWeakPtr() will hit the introduced CHECKs, or if it just hits the WeakPtr::get().)<span class="line"><!----> (and M86/87 cherry-picks), which introduced CHECKs for operator* and operator-&gt;. (Or maybe not, since I'm unsure if AsWeakPtr() will hit the introduced CHECKs, or if it just hits the WeakPtr::get().)<!----></span><br><br>I added an early return in this CL[1] to fix this issue, and avoid the UaF or CHECK crash. That said, I'm not a pepper / Filesystem OWNER[2], so I think //ppapi/OWNERS might be the right people to own this bug if this issue becomes more complex.<span class="line"><!---->I added an early return in this CL[1] to fix this issue, and avoid the UaF or CHECK crash. That said, I'm not a pepper / Filesystem OWNER[2], so I think //ppapi/OWNERS might be the right people to own this bug if this issue becomes more complex.<!----></span><br><br>+cc: ppapi owners, for visibility during review.<span class="line"><!---->+cc: ppapi owners, for visibility during review.<!----></span><br><br>[1]: <span class="line"><!---->[1]: <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/2527065<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2527065"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2527065<!----></a><br>[2]: <span class="line"><!---->[2]: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/OWNERS<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/OWNERS"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/OWNERS<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>
              
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>

        Description #1 by wfh@chromium.org (Nov 6, 2020)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by wfh@chromium.org (Nov 6, 2020)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by wfh@chromium.org (Nov 6, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by wfh@chromium.org (Nov 6, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      See parent bug for full exploit. This is for the sandbox escape part.<span class="line"><!---->See parent bug for full exploit. This is for the sandbox escape part.<!----></span><br><br># Sandbox Escape<span class="line"><!----># Sandbox Escape<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<span class="line"><!---->|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<span class="line"><!---->int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<span class="line"><!---->  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host->GetFileSystemHost(); <-----<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host-&gt;GetFileSystemHost(); &lt;-----<!----></span><br>  open_flags_ = open_flags;<span class="line"><!---->  open_flags_ = open_flags;<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<span class="line"><!---->And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<span class="line"><!---->void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  found->second->SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<span class="line"><!---->  found-&gt;second-&gt;SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<!----></span><br>  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found->second); <--------<span class="line"><!---->  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found-&gt;second); &lt;--------<!----></span><br>  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<span class="line"><!---->  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<span class="line"><!---->This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_->GetFileSystemOperationRunner()->OpenFile(<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_-&gt;GetFileSystemOperationRunner()-&gt;OpenFile(<!----></span><br>      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<span class="line"><!---->      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <span class="line"><!---->I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>    if (check_quota_)<span class="line"><!---->    if (check_quota_)<!----></span><br>      quota_file_system = file_system_host_->pp_resource();<span class="line"><!---->      quota_file_system = file_system_host_-&gt;pp_resource();<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<span class="line"><!---->After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<!----></a><br><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ppapi/host/ppapi_host.cc;l=262;drc=708fa822987d1b2146ce2659156a7713ac5e6810<a class="undefined"         Hey huangdarwin@, it's late on a Friday night, so it's that time again! Urgent security bug time!<span class="line"><!---->Hey huangdarwin@, it's late on a Friday night, so it's that time again! Urgent security bug time!<!----></span><br><br>In all seriousness I am regarding this as Pri-1 which means it can wait till Monday. Nevertheless I do think you're probably the best owner so please do look on Monday.<span class="line"><!---->In all seriousness I am regarding this as Pri-1 which means it can wait till Monday. Nevertheless I do think you're probably the best owner so please do look on Monday.<!----></span><br><br>What we have here is a situation where code is relying on a WeakPtr, and the compiler is optimising out the WeakPtr check. I feel we should fix WeakPtr, for which I've raised <span class="line"><!---->What we have here is a situation where code is relying on a WeakPtr, and the compiler is optimising out the WeakPtr check. I feel we should fix WeakPtr, for which I've raised <!----></span>issue 1146679<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1146679" title="Security: WeakPtr checks are optimized out"><!---->issue 1146679<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>but please can you own whether any changes are needed in the filesystem code.<span class="line"><!---->but please can you own whether any changes are needed in the filesystem code.<!----></span><br><br>You're unlikely to be able to reproduce this. The bug is part of an exploit chain submitted at the Tian Fu Cup today, and it's a pretty complex POC. However, if you really need to reproduce this, I think we might be able to pick it apart and get the MojoJS bits running without the rest of the exploit - using these instructions - <span class="line"><!---->You're unlikely to be able to reproduce this. The bug is part of an exploit chain submitted at the Tian Fu Cup today, and it's a pretty complex POC. However, if you really need to reproduce this, I think we might be able to pick it apart and get the MojoJS bits running without the rest of the exploit - using these instructions - <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/clusterfuzz-for-sheriffs.md#mojojs<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/clusterfuzz-for-sheriffs.md#mojojs"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/clusterfuzz-for-sheriffs.md#mojojs<!----></a> - but it will take many hours so I'm hoping you don't need that.<span class="line"><!----> - but it will take many hours so I'm hoping you don't need that.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        My understanding from looking at <span class="line"><!---->My understanding from looking at <!----></span>https://crbug.com/1146679<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1146679" title="Security: WeakPtr checks are optimized out"><!---->https://crbug.com/1146679<!----></a>, as mentioned in <span class="line"><!---->, as mentioned in <!----></span>Comment #2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c2"><!---->Comment #2<!----></a>, is that this UaF might already be fixed by <span class="line"><!---->, is that this UaF might already be fixed by <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/2463857<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2463857"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2463857<!----></a> (and M86/87 cherry-picks), which introduced CHECKs for operator* and operator->. (Or maybe not, since I'm unsure if AsWeakPtr() will hit the introduced CHECKs, or if it just hits the WeakPtr::get().)<span class="line"><!----> (and M86/87 cherry-picks), which introduced CHECKs for operator* and operator-&gt;.         This bug requires manual review: We are only 6 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 6 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <!----></span>http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br><br>Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Owners: benmason@(Android), bindusuvarna @(iOS), cindyb@(ChromeOS), lakpamarthy@(Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: benmason@(Android), bindusuvarna @(iOS), cindyb@(ChromeOS), lakpamarthy@(Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div>
      See parent bug for full exploit. This is for the sandbox escape part.<span class="line"><!---->See parent bug for full exploit. This is for the sandbox escape part.<!----></span><br><br># Sandbox Escape<span class="line"><!----># Sandbox Escape<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<span class="line"><!---->|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<span class="line"><!---->int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<span class="line"><!---->  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host->GetFileSystemHost(); <-----<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host-&gt;GetFileSystemHost(); &lt;-----<!----></span><br>  open_flags_ = open_flags;<span class="line"><!---->  open_flags_ = open_flags;<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<span class="line"><!---->And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<span class="line"><!---->void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  found->second->SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<span class="line"><!---->  found-&gt;second-&gt;SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<!----></span><br>  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found->second); <--------<span class="line"><!---->  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found-&gt;second); &lt;--------<!----></span><br>  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<span class="line"><!---->  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<span class="line"><!---->This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_->GetFileSystemOperationRunner()->OpenFile(<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_-&gt;GetFileSystemOperationRunner()-&gt;OpenFile(<!----></span><br>      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<span class="line"><!---->      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <span class="line"><!---->I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>    if (check_quota_)<span class="line"><!---->    if (check_quota_)<!----></span><br>      quota_file_system = file_system_host_->pp_resource();<span class="line"><!---->      quota_file_system = file_system_host_-&gt;pp_resource();<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<span class="line"><!---->After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<a         Hey huangdarwin@, it's late on a Friday night, so it's that time again! Urgent security bug time!<span class="line"><!---->Hey huangdarwin@, it's late on a Friday night, so it's that time again! Urgent security bug time!<!----></span><br><br>In all seriousness I am regarding this as Pri-1 which means it can wait till Monday. Nevertheless I do think you're probably the best owner so please do look on Monday.<span class="line"><!---->In all seriousness I am regarding this as Pri-1 which means it can wait till Monday. Nevertheless I do think you're probably the best owner so please do look on Monday.<!----></span><br><br>What we have here is a situation where code is relying on a WeakPtr, and the compiler is optimising out the WeakPtr check. I feel we should fix WeakPtr, for which I've raised <span class="line"><!---->What we have here is a situation where code is relying on a WeakPtr, and the compiler is optimising out the WeakPtr check. I feel we should fix WeakPtr, for which I've raised <!----></span>issue 1146679<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1146679" title="Security: WeakPtr checks are optimized out"><!---->issue 1146679<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>but please can you own whether any changes are needed in the filesystem code.<span class="line"><!---->but please can you own whether any changes are needed in the filesystem code.<!----></span><br><br>You're unlikely to be able to reproduce this. The bug is part of an exploit chain submitted at the Tian Fu Cup today, and it's a pretty complex POC. However, if you really need to reproduce this, I think we might be able to pick it apart and get the MojoJS bits running without the rest of the exploit - using these instructions - <span class="line"><!---->You're unlikely to be able to reproduce this. The bug is part of an exploit chain submitted at the Tian Fu Cup today, and it's a pretty complex POC. However, if you really need to reproduce this, I think we might be able to pick it apart and get the MojoJS bits running without the rest of the exploit - using these instructions - <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/clusterfuzz-for-sheriffs.md#mojojs<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/clusterfuzz-for-sheriffs.md#mojojs"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/clusterfuzz-for-sheriffs.md#mojojs<!----></a> - but it will take many hours so I'm hoping you don't need that.<span class="line"><!----> - but it will take many hours so I'm hoping you don't need that.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        My understanding from looking at <span class="line"><!---->My understanding from looking at <!----></span>https://crbug.com/1146679<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1146679" title="Security: WeakPtr checks are optimized out"><!---->https://crbug.com/1146679<!----></a>, as mentioned in <span class="line"><!---->, as mentioned in <!----></span>Comment #2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c2"><!---->Comment #2<!----></a>, is that this UaF might already be fixed by <span class="line"><!---->, is that this UaF might already be fixed by <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/2463857<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2463857"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2463857<!----></a> (and M86/87 cherry-picks), which introduced CHECKs for operator* and operator->. (Or maybe not, since I'm unsure if AsWeakPtr() will hit the introduced CHECKs, or if it just hits the WeakPtr::get().)<span class="line"><!----> (and M86/87 cherry-picks), which introduced CHECKs for operator* and operator-&gt;.         This bug requires manual review: We are only 6 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 6 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8.         This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks.       </div>
      See parent bug for full exploit. This is for the sandbox escape part.<span class="line"><!---->See parent bug for full exploit. This is for the sandbox escape part.<!----></span><br><br># Sandbox Escape<span class="line"><!----># Sandbox Escape<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<span class="line"><!---->|file_system_host_|[1] will keep the pointer of PepperFileSystemBrowserHost in PepperFileIOHost<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<span class="line"><!---->int32_t PepperFileIOHost::OnHostMsgOpen(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<span class="line"><!---->  	return PP_ERROR_FAILED;<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host->GetFileSystemHost(); <-----<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_ = file_ref_host-&gt;GetFileSystemHost(); &lt;-----<!----></span><br>  open_flags_ = open_flags;<span class="line"><!---->  open_flags_ = open_flags;<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<span class="line"><!---->And the life cycle of  is PepperFileSystemBrowserHost managed by map |resources_|[2]. We can replace it by creating another resource_host with the same |pp_resource|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<span class="line"><!---->void PpapiHost::OnHostMsgAttachToPendingHost(PP_Resource pp_resource,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  found->second->SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<span class="line"><!---->  found-&gt;second-&gt;SetPPResourceForPendingHost(pp_resource);<!----></span><br>  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found->second); <--------<span class="line"><!---->  resources_[pp_resource] = std::move(found-&gt;second); &lt;--------<!----></span><br>  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<span class="line"><!---->  pending_resource_hosts_.erase(found);<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<span class="line"><!---->This will destroy PepperFileSystemBrowserHost, but its weak pointer |file_system_host_| can still be used. And due to compilation optimization, in the stable release version, the weak pointer check will be invalid[3]. So we can use the UAF[4] of the pointer to finally call the virtual table function |CreateFileSystemOperation|.<!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::GotUIThreadStuffForInternalFileSystems(<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>  file_system_host_->GetFileSystemOperationRunner()->OpenFile(<span class="line"><!---->  file_system_host_-&gt;GetFileSystemOperationRunner()-&gt;OpenFile(<!----></span><br>      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<span class="line"><!---->      file_system_url_, platform_file_flags,<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;DidOpenFile, AsWeakPtr(), task_runner_,<!----></span><br>  ...<span class="line"><!---->  ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <span class="line"><!---->I found that there is a path[5] to reply the 4 bytes|pp_resource_| of the UAF object to the renderer process. It is in the 0x14-0x18 position of this structure. So I can look for a structure with the heap address here to leak the high 4 bytes of the heap. <!----></span><br><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<span class="line"><!---->void PepperFileIOHost::SendFileOpenReply(<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>    if (check_quota_)<span class="line"><!---->    if (check_quota_)<!----></span><br>      quota_file_system = file_system_host_->pp_resource();<span class="line"><!---->      quota_file_system = file_system_host_-&gt;pp_resource();<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<span class="line"><!---->After we obtain the high 4 bytes of the heap, we can predict the high 4 bytes of the heap which will be allocated later. Then we can spray up 8 GB payload and combined with the virtual call to complete the exploit.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:content/browser/renderer_host/pepper/pepper_file_io_host.cc;l=178;drc=8f372b1bcee52c779926c632f1c2eb3a42a085ce<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         Hey huangdarwin@, it's late on a Friday night, so it's that time again! Urgent security bug time!<span class="line"><!---->Hey huangdarwin@, it's late on a Friday night, so it's that time again! Urgent security bug time!<!----></span><br><br>In all seriousness I am regarding this as Pri-1 which means it can wait till Monday. Nevertheless I do think you're probably the best owner so please do look on Monday.<span class="line"><!---->In all seriousness I am regarding this as Pri-1 which means it can wait till Monday. Nevertheless I do think you're probably the best owner so please do look on Monday.<!----></span><br><br>What we have here is a situation where code is relying on a WeakPtr, and the compiler is optimising out the WeakPtr check. I feel we should fix WeakPtr, for which I've raised <span class="line"><!---->What we have here is a situation where code is relying on a WeakPtr, and the compiler is optimising out the WeakPtr check. I feel we should fix WeakPtr, for which I've raised <!----></span>issue 1146679<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1146679" title="Security: WeakPtr checks are optimized out"><!---->issue 1146679<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>but please can you own whether any changes are needed in the filesystem code.<span class="line"><!---->but please can you own whether any changes are needed in the filesystem code.<!----></span><br><br>You're unlikely to be able to reproduce this. The bug is part of an exploit chain submitted at the Tian Fu Cup today, and it's a pretty complex POC. However, if you really need to reproduce this, I think we might be able to pick it apart and get the MojoJS bits running without the rest of the exploit - using these instructions - <span class="line"><!---->You're unlikely to be able to reproduce this. The bug is part of an exploit chain submitted at the Tian Fu Cup today, and it's a pretty complex POC. However, if you really need to reproduce this, I think we might be able to pick it apart and get the MojoJS bits running without the rest of the exploit - using these instructions - <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/clusterfuzz-for-sheriffs.md#mojojs<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/clusterfuzz-for-sheriffs.md#mojojs"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/clusterfuzz-for-sheriffs.md#mojojs<!----></a> - but it will take many hours so I'm hoping you don't need that.<span class="line"><!----> - but it will take many hours so I'm hoping you don't need that.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        My understanding from looking at <span class="line"><!---->My understanding from looking at <!----></span>https://crbug.com/1146679<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1146679" title="Security: WeakPtr checks are optimized out"><!---->https://crbug.com/1146679<!----></a>, as mentioned in <span class="line"><!---->, as mentioned in <!----></span>Comment #2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c2"><!---->Comment #2<!----></a>, is that this UaF might already be fixed by <span class="line"><!---->, is that this UaF might already be fixed by <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/2463857<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2463857"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2463857<!----></a> (and M86/87 cherry-picks), which introduced CHECKs for operator* and operator->. (Or maybe not, since I'm unsure if AsWeakPtr() will hit the introduced CHECKs, or if it just hits the WeakPtr::get().)<span class="line"><!----> (and M86/87 cherry-picks), which introduced CHECKs for operator* and operator-&gt;.             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        </table>
      </div>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>

<a class="__crdxFeedbackButton" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/monorail/issues/entry?template=Online%20Feedback"></a>
